text:
<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
performs an XLEN-bit \(\times\) XLEN-bit multiplication of signed rs1 by unsigned rs2 and places the upper XLEN bits in the destination register.[/INST] x[rd] = (x[rs1] s latexmath:[$\times$] x[rs2]) >>s XLEN</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
performs an XLEN-bit \(\times\) XLEN-bit multiplication of unsigned rs1 by unsigned rs2 and places the upper XLEN bits in the destination register.[/INST] x[rd] = (x[rs1] u latexmath:[$\times$] x[rs2]) >>u XLEN</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an XLEN bits by XLEN bits signed integer division of rs1 by rs2, rounding towards zero.[/INST] x[rd] = x[rs1] /s x[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an XLEN bits by XLEN bits unsigned integer division of rs1 by rs2, rounding towards zero.[/INST] x[rd] = x[rs1] /u x[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an XLEN bits by XLEN bits signed integer reminder of rs1 by rs2.[/INST] x[rd] = x[rs1] %s x[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an XLEN bits by XLEN bits unsigned integer reminder of rs1 by rs2.[/INST] x[rd] = x[rs1] %u x[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an 32 bits by 32 bits signed integer division of rs1 by rs2.[/INST] x[rd] = sext((x[rs1] × x[rs2])[31:0])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an 32 bits by 32 bits signed integer division of rs1 by rs2.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(x[rs1][31:0] /s x[rs2][31:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
perform an 32 bits by 32 bits signed integer reminder of rs1 by rs2.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(x[rs1][31:0] %s x[rs2][31:0])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
load a word from the address in rs1, places the sign-extended value in rd, and registers a reservation on the memory address.[/INST] x[rd] = LoadReserved32(M[x[rs1]])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
write a word in rs2 to the address in rs1, provided a valid reservation still exists on that address. SC writes zero to rd on success or a nonzero code on failure.[/INST] x[rd] = StoreConditional32(M[x[rs1]], x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, swap the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] SWAP x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply add the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] + x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply exclusive or the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] ^ x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply and the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] & x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply or the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] | x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply min operator the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] MIN x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit signed data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply max operator the loaded value and the original 32-bit signed value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] MAX x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit unsigned data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply unsigned min the loaded value and the original 32-bit unsigned value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] MINU x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Atomically load a 32-bit unsigned data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply unsigned max the loaded value and the original 32-bit unsigned value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO32(M[x[rs1]] MAXU x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
load a 64-bit data from the address in rs1, places value in rd, and registers a reservation on the memory address.[/INST] x[rd] = LoadReserved64(M[x[rs1]])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
write a 64-bit data in rs2 to the address in rs1, provided a valid reservation still exists on that address. SC writes zero to rd on success or a nonzero code on failure.[/INST] x[rd] = StoreConditional64(M[x[rs1]], x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, swap the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] SWAP x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply add the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] + x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply xor the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] ^ x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply and the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] & x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply or the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] | x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply min the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] MIN x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply max the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] MAX x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply unsigned min the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] MINU x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
atomically load a 64-bit data value from the address in rs1, place the value into register rd, apply unsigned max the loaded value and the original 64-bit value in rs2, then store the result back to the address in rs1.[/INST] x[rd] = AMO64(M[x[rs1]] MAXU x[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision fused multiply addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1]×f[rs2]+f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision fused multiply addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1]×f[rs2]-f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform negated single-precision fused multiply subtraction.[/INST] f[rd] = -f[rs1]×f[rs2]+f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform negated single-precision fused multiply addition.[/INST] f[rd] = -f[rs1]×f[rs2]-f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision floating-point addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] + f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision floating-point substraction.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] - f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision floating-point multiplication.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] × f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision floating-point division.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] / f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform single-precision square root.[/INST] f[rd] = sqrt(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Produce a result that takes all bits except the sign bit from rs1. The result’s sign bit is rs2’s sign bit.[/INST] f[rd] = {f[rs2][31], f[rs1][30:0]}</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Produce a result that takes all bits except the sign bit from rs1. The result’s sign bit is opposite of rs2’s sign bit.[/INST] f[rd] = {~f[rs2][31], f[rs1][30:0]}</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Produce a result that takes all bits except the sign bit from rs1. The result’s sign bit is XOR of sign bit of rs1 and rs2.[/INST] f[rd] = {f[rs1][31] ^ f[rs2][31], f[rs1][30:0]}</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Write the smaller of single precision data in rs1 and rs2 to rd.[/INST] f[rd] = min(f[rs1], f[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Write the larger of single precision data in rs1 and rs2 to rd.[/INST] f[rd] = max(f[rs1], f[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Convert a floating-point number in floating-point register rs1 to a signed 32-bit in integer register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(f32->s32(f[rs1]))</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Convert a floating-point number in floating-point register rs1 to a signed 32-bit in unsigned integer register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(f32->u32(f[rs1]))</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Move the single-precision value in floating-point register rs1 represented in IEEE 754-2008 encoding to the lower 32 bits of integer register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(f[rs1][31:0])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet equal comparison between single-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] == f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet less comparison between single-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] < f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet less or equal comparison between single-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] <= f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Examines the value in single-precision floating-point register rs1 and writes to integer register rd a 10-bit mask that indicates the class of the floating-point number. The format of the mask is described in [classify table]_. The corresponding bit in rd will be set if the property is true and clear otherwise. All other bits in rd are cleared. Note that exactly one bit in rd will be set.[/INST] x[rd] = classify_s(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 32-bit signed integer, in integer register rs1 into a floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = s32->f32(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 32-bit unsigned integer, in integer register rs1 into a floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = u32->f32(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Move the single-precision value encoded in IEEE 754-2008 standard encoding from the lower 32 bits of integer register rs1 to the floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = x[rs1][31:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision fused multiply addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1]×f[rs2]+f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision fused multiply subtraction.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1]×f[rs2]-f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform negated double-precision fused multiply subtraction.[/INST] f[rd] = -f[rs1]×f[rs2]+f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform negated double-precision fused multiply addition.[/INST] f[rd] = -f[rs1]×f[rs2]-f[rs3]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision floating-point addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] + f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision floating-point addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] - f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision floating-point addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] × f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision floating-point addition.[/INST] f[rd] = f[rs1] / f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Perform double-precision square root.[/INST] f[rd] = sqrt(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Produce a result that takes all bits except the sign bit from rs1. The result’s sign bit is rs2’s sign bit.[/INST] f[rd] = {f[rs2][63], f[rs1][62:0]}</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Produce a result that takes all bits except the sign bit from rs1. The result’s sign bit is opposite of rs2’s sign bit.[/INST] f[rd] = {~f[rs2][63], f[rs1][62:0]}</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Produce a result that takes all bits except the sign bit from rs1. The result’s sign bit is XOR of sign bit of rs1 and rs2.[/INST] f[rd] = {f[rs1][63] ^ f[rs2][63], f[rs1][62:0]}</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Write the smaller of double precision data in rs1 and rs2 to rd.[/INST] f[rd] = min(f[rs1], f[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Write the larger of double precision data in rs1 and rs2 to rd.[/INST] f[rd] = max(f[rs1], f[rs2])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts double floating-point register in rs1 into a floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = f64->f32(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts single floating-point register in rs1 into a double floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = f32->f64(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet equal comparison between double-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] == f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet less comparison between double-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] < f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet less or equal comparison between double-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] <= f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Examines the value in double-precision floating-point register rs1 and writes to integer register rd a 10-bit mask that indicates the class of the floating-point number. The format of the mask is described in table [classify table]_. The corresponding bit in rd will be set if the property is true and clear otherwise. All other bits in rd are cleared. Note that exactly one bit in rd will be set.[/INST] x[rd] = classifys(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a double-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rs1 to a signed 32-bit integer, in integer register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(f64->s32(f[rs1]))</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a double-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rs1 to a unsigned 32-bit integer, in integer register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(u32f64(f[rs1]))</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 32-bit signed integer, in integer register rs1 into a double-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(f64->s32(f[rs1]))</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 32-bit unsigned integer, in integer register rs1 into a double-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = u32->f64(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a single-precision floating-point value from memory into floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = M[x[rs1] + sext(offset)][31:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Store a single-precision value from floating-point register rs2 to memory.[/INST] M[x[rs1] + sext(offset)] = f[rs2][31:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a double-precision floating-point value from memory into floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = M[x[rs1] + sext(offset)][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Store a double-precision value from the floating-point registers to memory.[/INST] M[x[rs1] + sext(offset)] = f[rs2][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.l.d rd,rs1[/INST] x[rd] = f32->s64(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.l.d rd,rs1[/INST] x[rd] = f32->u64(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.l.d rd,rs1[/INST] f[rd] = s64->f32(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.l.d rd,rs1[/INST] f[rd] = u64->f32(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.lu.d rd,rs1[/INST] x[rd] = f64->s64(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
x[rd] = f64→u64(f[rs1])[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.d.l rd,rs1[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fcvt.d.lu rd,rs1[/INST] f[rd] = s64->f64(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
fmv.d.x rd,rs1[/INST] f[rd] = u64->f64(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Add a zero-extended non-zero immediate, scaled by 4, to the stack pointer, x2, and writes the result to rd'. This instruction is used to generate pointers to stack-allocated variables, and expands to addi rd', x2, nzuimm[9:2].[/INST] f[rd] = x[rs1][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Add a zero-extended non-zero immediate, scaled by 4, to the stack pointer, x2, and writes the result to rd'. This instruction is used to generate pointers to stack-allocated variables, and expands to addi rd', x2, nzuimm[9:2].[/INST] x[8+rd'] = x[2] + uimm</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a double-precision floating-point value from memory into floating-point register rd'. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 8, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] f[8+rd'] = M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a 32-bit value from memory into register rd'. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 4, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] x[8+rd'] = sext(M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][31:0])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a single-precision floating-point value from memory into floating-point register rd'. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 4, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] f[8+rd'] = M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][31:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a 64-bit value from memory into register rd'. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 8, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] x[8+rd'] = M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][63:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Store a 32-bit value in register rs2' to memory. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 4, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][31:0] = x[8+rs2']</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Store a single-precision floating-point value in floatingpoint register rs2' to memory. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 4, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][31:0] = f[8+rs2']</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Store a 64-bit value in register rs2' to memory. It computes an effective address by adding the zero-extended offset, scaled by 8, to the base address in register rs1'.[/INST] M[x[8+rs1'] + uimm][63:0] = x[8+rs2']</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Add the non-zero sign-extended 6-bit immediate to the value in register rd then writes the result to rd.[/INST] x[rd] = x[rd] + sext(imm)</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Jump to address and place return address in rd.[/INST] x[1] = pc+2; pc += sext(offset)</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Add the non-zero sign-extended 6-bit immediate to the value in register rd then produce 32-bit result, then sign-extends result to 64 bits.[/INST] x[rd] = sext((x[rd] + sext(imm))[31:0])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet equal comparison between half-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] == f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet less comparison between half-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] < f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Performs a quiet less or equal comparison between half-precision floating-point registers rs1 and rs2 and record the Boolean result in integer register rd. Only signaling NaN inputs cause an Invalid Operation exception. The result is 0 if either operand is NaN.[/INST] x[rd] = f[rs1] <= f[rs2]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Examines the value in half-precision floating-point register rs1 and writes to integer register rd a 10-bit mask that indicates the class of the floating-point number. The format of the mask is described in [classify table]_. The corresponding bit in rd will be set if the property is true and clear otherwise. All other bits in rd are cleared. Note that exactly one bit in rd will be set.[/INST] x[rd] = classify_s(f[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts half-precision floating point number in floating point register in rs1 into a sigend integer in integer register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = f16->s32(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts half-precision floating point number in floating point register in rs1 into a unsigned integer in integer register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = f16->u32(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Move the half-precision value in floating-point register rs1 represented in IEEE 754-2008 encoding to the lower 32 bits of integer register rd.[/INST] x[rd] = sext(f[rs1][15:0])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 32-bit signed integer, in integer register rs1 into a half-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = u32->f16(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 32-bit unsigned integer, in integer register rs1 into a half-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = u32->f16(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Move the half-precision value encoded in IEEE 754-2008 standard encoding from the lower 15 bits of integer register rs1 to the floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = x[rs1][15:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Load a half-precision floating-point value from memory into floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = M[x[rs1] + sext(offset)][15:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Store a half-precision value from floating-point register rs2 to memory.[/INST] M[x[rs1] + sext(offset)] = f[rs2][15:0]</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts half-precision floating point number in floating point register in rs1 into a 64-bit sigend integer in integer register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = f16->s64(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts half-precision floating point number in floating point register in rs1 into a 64-bit unsigned integer in integer register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = f16->s64(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 64-bit signed integer, in integer register rs1 into a half-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = u64->f16(x[rs1])</s>

<s>[INST] Write the RISC-V assembly instruction for the following operation:
Converts a 64-bit unsigned integer, in integer register rs1 into a half-precision floating-point number in floating-point register rd.[/INST] f[rd] = u64->f16(x[rs1])</s>
